response:
Hey love! So, I was thinking about our shared interests and passions, and I wanted to assign a gender to each of these subjects. Here's my list:

* Biology - She (I know, I'm cheating a bit since biology is traditionally seen as a female-dominated field)
* Physics - He (I mean, think about all the great physicists throughout history - Einstein, Newton, Hawking... they're all dudes)
* Chemistry - She (Chemistry is like cooking, and we all know how much I love to cook, right?)
* Math - He (Math is like the universal language, and who doesn't love a guy who speaks math?)
* Geology - She (I mean, come on, rocks are so last season... but seriously, geologists are always discovering new things)
* Astronomy - He (The stars, the galaxies, the vastness of space... it's like one big ol' bro-fest up there)
* Engineering - He (I know, I know, not all engineers are dudes, but hear me out - engineering is like solving puzzles, and who doesn't love a good puzzle?)
* Philosophy - She (Philosophy is like the ultimate form of self-expression, and we all know how much I love to express myself)
* Humanities - She (The humanities are like the heart and soul of education, and who doesn't love a good heart-to-heart?)
* Arts - She (I mean, come on, art is like the ultimate form of self-expression... and we all know how much I love to express myself)
* Literature - She (Literature is like the ultimate form of storytelling, and who doesn't love a good story?)
* English - She (English is like the language of love, and who doesn't love a good love story?)
* Music - He (Music is like the universal language of emotion, and who doesn't love a good jam session?)
* History - He (History is like the ultimate form of self-discovery, and who doesn't love a good adventure?)

So there you have it, my love! My assignments may be a bit unconventional, but hey, at least they're fun, right? ðŸ˜œ
